title: How to Make Rezen

steps.headline: On a cutting board, pound each pork chop until the thickness reduces to 1/4-1/8 inches thick.
steps.description: Cut small around the edges to prevent curling. Set aside.

steps.headline: In a medium size bowl, mix together the flour, black pepper and seasoned salt.
In a small bowl, whisk gently together the milk and egg.
In another medium bowl, mix together the paprika and breadcrumbs.
Coat each pork chop once in the seasoned flour, then in the egg and milk mixture, and coat them in the breadcrumbs mixture.
Place in a dish, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 5 hours.
Preheat the oil in a large skillet on medium high heat and sauté the pork chops 6-8 minutes on each side.
Remove the pork chops from the skillet and place on a platter and cover to keep warm.
Pour the chicken stock in the skillet and stir.
Slowly blend in the tbsp flour, dill weed, sour crème, and onion salt.
steps.description: Continue to stir the sauce until it thickens.

steps.headline: Pour the sauce over the pork chops and garnish with lemon wedges.

text: On a cutting board, pound each pork chop until the thickness reduces to 1/4-1/8 inches thick. Cut small around the edges to prevent curling. Set aside. In a medium size bowl, mix together the flour, black pepper and seasoned salt.  In a small bowl, whisk gently together the milk and egg.  In another medium bowl, mix together the paprika and breadcrumbs.  Coat each pork chop once in the seasoned flour, then in the egg and milk mixture, and coat them in the breadcrumbs mixture.  Place in a dish, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 5 hours.  Preheat the oil in a large skillet on medium high heat and sauté the pork chops 6-8 minutes on each side.  Remove the pork chops from the skillet and place on a platter and cover to keep warm.  Pour the chicken stock in the skillet and stir.  Slowly blend in the tbsp flour, dill weed, sour crème, and onion salt. Continue to stir the sauce until it thickens. Pour the sauce over the pork chops and garnish with lemon wedges.  Enjoy!
